definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: The new typist is green at her job.
sentences.chinese: 剛來的打字員是個熟手。

sentences.english: Do you still have openings for the typist？
sentences.chinese: 貴公司還有打字員的空缺嗎？

sentences.english: The publishing firm was advertising for a typist.
sentences.chinese: 這家出版公司正在登廣告招聘一名打字員。

sentences.english: The typist received an admonition from the supervisor for being careless.
sentences.chinese: 那個打字員因粗心大意受到監督人的訓誡。

sentences.english: All the best , " called the other typists in chorus."
sentences.chinese: “祝萬事如意，”其他打字員齊聲喊道。

sentences.english: Well, we only employ book-keepers and typewriters here.
sentences.chinese: 是這樣，我們這裏只僱傭會計師和打字員。

sentences.english: She dictated a letter to a typist.
The two typists have already worked all day.
sentences.chinese: 這兩位打字員已經工作一整天了。

sentences.english: Kitty was down on the junior typist.
sentences.chinese: 基蒂仇視那個年輕的打字員。

sentences.english: Geeta got a job in a school as a typist.
sentences.chinese: 吉塔找到了一份在學校裏做打字員的工作。

sentences.english: I've worked here as a typist for about a year，and I'd like to have a chance of advancement.
sentences.chinese: 我在此已做打字員一年了，我期望一個升遷的機會。

sentences.english: Those typists at the office never do anything right!
sentences.chinese: 辦公室的那些打字員從來沒把事幹好過。

sentences.english: The tutor used to be a typist, so she brought the typewriter with her.
sentences.chinese: 家庭教師過去曾是個打字員，因此隨身帶着打字機。

sentences.english: At best she is an adequate typist.
sentences.chinese: 她至多是個稱職的打字員。

sentences.english: The typist plays Typhoon on the piano in a typical style.
sentences.chinese: 打字員以典範的風致在鋼琴上呼奏“颱風”。
